DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Study Protocol Therapy Begin Administration Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to start of administration of  therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Study Protocol Therapeutic Procedure Begin Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to start of administration of  therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense.:The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Will the patient start protoc
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient start protocol treatment

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient proceed to protocol treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient receive this step's protocol treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: MA39
ReferenceDocuments.description: Protocol treatment will begin within 3 weeks of patient randomization

ReferenceDocuments.name: CE7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Protocol therapy will begin within 14 days of randomization.

ReferenceDocuments.name: ALT_MA39_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Protocol treatment will begin within 6 weeks of patient randomization.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Protocol treatment will begin within 7 working days of patient enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_03
ReferenceDocuments.description: Investigator confirms patient is planned for definitive RT or CRT with bilateral neck RT.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_02
ReferenceDocuments.description: Protocol treatment (i.e. definitive RT) will begin within 28 days (+14 days) of randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient plan to start a standard neoadjuvant Pertuzumab (or other biosimilars) based regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient completed the baseline (T0) FDG-PET/CT prior to registration, will the patient start the neoadjuvant Pertuzumab-based regimen after study registration, and within 21 days after the T0 scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_04
ReferenceDocuments.description: Protocol treatment will begin within 12 weeks of participant enrollment.
